meanings.definition: To grant a license to a third party to use or distribute a product or service.
meanings.sent1: The company sublicensed their software to another business for marketing purposes.
meanings.sent2: She sublicensed the design to a local manufacturer for production.
meanings.sent3: The software felt proud to be sublicensed to a new user.
meanings.sent4: The idea of sharing the recipe was sublicensed to the eager chef.
meanings.sent5: The license was sublicensed with a golden seal of approval.

meanings.definition: To obtain a license from a licensee to use a product or service.
meanings.sent1: He sublicensed the technology from the original developer for his project.
meanings.sent2: They sublicensed the patent from the inventor to create their product.
meanings.sent3: The cat felt clever when it sublicensed the toy from the dog.
meanings.sent4: Her mind sublicensed the idea from the book she read.
meanings.sent5: The team sublicensed the expertise to complete the task efficiently.
